content.question: For the first curve: Moving from left to right: The curve passes from quadrant 2 to quadrant 1. The curve trends up gradually then sharply. The curve is asymptotic to the x axis. The curve passes through the following approximate points: (negative 2 comma 0.2) (negative 1 comma 0.4) (0 comma 1) (1 comma 3) (1.5 comma 5) For the second curve: Moving from left to right: The curve passes from quadrant 4 to quadrant 1. The curve trends up sharply then gradually. The curve is asymptotic to the y axis. The curve passes through the following approximate points: (0.2 comma negative 2) (0.4 comma negative 1) (1 comma 0) (3 comma 1) (5 comma 1.5) For the first curve: Moving from left to right: The curve passes from quadrant 2 to quadrant 3. The curve trends down gradually then sharply. The curve is asymptotic to the y axis. The curve passes through the following approximate points: (negative 5 comma 1.5) (negative 3 comma 1) (negative 1 comma 0) (negative 0.4 comma negative 1) (negative 0.2 comma negative 2) For the second curve: Moving from left to right: The curve passes from quadrant 2 to quadrant 1. The curve trends down sharply then gradually. The curve is asymptotic to the x axis. The curve passes through the following approximate points: (negative 1.5 comma 5) (negative 1 comma 3) (0 comma 1) (1 comma 0.4) (2 comma 0.2) For the first curve: Moving from left to right: The curve passes from quadrant 2 to quadrant 1. The curve trends up gradually then sharply. The curve is asymptotic to the x axis. The curve passes through the following approximate points: (negative 2 comma 0.2) (negative 1 comma 0.4) (0 comma 1) (1 comma 3) (1.5 comma 5) For the second curve: Moving from left to right: The curve passes from quadrant 3 to quadrant 4. The curve trends down gradually then sharply. The curve is asymptotic to the x axis. The curve passes through the following approximate points: (negative 2 comma negative 0.2) (negative 1 comma negative 0.4) (0 comma negative 1) (1 comma negative 3) (1.5 comma negative 5) For the first curve: Moving from left to right: The curve passes from quadrant 2 to quadrant 1. The curve trends up gradually then sharply. The curve is asymptotic to the x axis. The curve passes through the following approximate points: (negative 2 comma 0.2) (negative 1 comma 0.4) (0 comma 1) (1 comma 3) (1.5 comma 5) For the second curve: Moving from left to right: The curve passes from quadrant 2 to quadrant 1. The curve trends down sharply then gradually. The curve is asymptotic to the x axis. The curve passes through the following approximate points: (negative 1.5 comma 5) (negative 1 comma 3) (0 comma 1) (1 comma 0.4) (2 comma 0.2) The functions <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> and <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> are inverse functions such that <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals f inverse open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>. Which of the following could be the graphs of <math alttext="y equals f open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> and <math alttext="y equals g open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> in the same <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane?

choices.label: Graph of 2 curves in the x y plane with the origin labeled O. The x axis ranges from negative 5 to 5. The y axis ranges from negative 5 to 5. The 2 curves are reflections of each other. Refer to long description.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
